question.title: What is the condition under which health professionals and establishments are liable for the harmful consequences of their actions?
question.description: The concept of fault in medical liability

option_a.title: Infringement of a patient's rights
option_a.description: A patient claiming a right has been infringed may hold a doctor or healthcare establishment liable

option_b.title: Technical negligence, which consists of a breach of established medical knowledge or scientific data
option_b.description: A breach of established medical knowledge or scientific data leading to a proven medical standard

option_c.title: Breach of a duty of humanism, which refers to the 'human' dimension of medical practice
option_c.description: A breach of professional secrecy or lack of information preventing informed consent

option_d.title: The event giving rise to liability must be a proven breach of a legal regulation
option_d.description: A breach of a legal regulation, such as the French Public Health Code

correct_option.title: technical negligence, which consists of a breach of established medical knowledge or scientific data
correct_option.description: A breach of established medical knowledge or scientific data leading to a proven medical standard
